title: US Senate Compromise Ends Historic Shutdown, Markets Rally
snippets: After 41 days of a government shutdown, the U.S. Senate has passed a set of bills to reopen the government. Its fate in the House is uncertain.
US Senate passes bill to end government shutdown, sends to House Reuters
Health insurers slide as US reaches government shutdown deal without extending subsidies Reuters
What's in the deal to end the longest US government shutdown? Reuters
Instant view: Markets cheer signs of progress to end US government shutdown Reuters
The measure still needs to be approved by the House and signed by President Donald Trump.

The vote comes after an agreement was reached by a group of Democrats who voted with Republicans to advance a measure to end the shutdown, the longest in US history. It now heads to the House for a final vote.
Senate passes package to end record government shutdown Axios
Senate votes to move forward with deal to end government shutdown Axios
The deal does not include extend enhanced ACA tax credits, which had been the key demand by most Democrats since the government shutdown began Oct. 1.

The Senate on Monday passed a bill that will fund the government through Jan. 30. It now goes to the House where a vote could come as early as Wednesday.
US Shutdown Nears End as Senate Passes Deal, House Readies Vote Bloomberg.com
The government shutdown reached its 41st day Monday, marking the longest shutdown in history by nearly a week.
It will need to be approved by the House and then signed into law by the president before the government can reopen.

The deal, supported by the White House, is expected to be implemented in the coming days and includes a commitment from Republican leaders to vote on a health care bill drafted by Democrats. Despite the resolution, health insurers saw a decline due to the absence of extended subsidies in the agreement. The conclusion of the shutdown has led to a rally in stock indexes and a rise in risk currencies, alongside improvements in Indian shares and optimism in vari

title: Flight Disruptions Rise Amid Shutdown, Trump Proposes $10K Controller Bonus
snippets: Trump said on social media that he wasn't happy with controllers who called out of work, and suggested a $10,000 bonus for those who didn't take any time off during the shutdown.
Trump threatens air traffic controllers who fail to return to work as flight cancellations jump Reuters
Trump threatens to cut air traffic controllers' pay Axios
Flight delays and cancellations piled up in recent days as air traffic controller staffing shortages worsen in the government shutdown.
Trump Warns Air Traffic Controllers to Work or Get ‘Docked’ Bloomberg.com
Air travelers should expect worsening cancellations and delays this week even if the government shutdown ends.
titles: Trump slams air traffic controllers who called out during the government shutdown

summary: During the government shutdown, flight delays and cancellations increased due to air traffic controller staffing shortages. President Trump criticized controllers who took time off and suggested a $10,000 bonus for those who didn't. He also threatened to cut pay and warned of work requirements, as he urged controllers to return to their jobs to mitigate the disruptions. The FAA had previously ordered airlines to cut flights because of these shortages, affecting flights across the US, including the closure of 12 major airports to private jets.

title: Car Explosion Near Red Fort in New Delhi Kills 8, Injures 20
snippets: A car exploded near the 17th century Red Fort in New Delhi on Monday, killing at least eight people, injuring others and triggering a fire that damaged vehicles parked nearby, New Delhi police said.
Eight killed in car explosion near Red Fort in India's Delhi Reuters

India’s top security official said the cause of the blast, near the Red Fort in the capital, was still being investigated.

At least eight people were killed on Monday in a car explosion near the historic Red Fort in a densely populated area of the Indian capital of New Delhi, a police spokesperson said. It was a rare blast in the heavily guarded city of more than 30 million people.
Car blast near New Delhi’s historic Red Fort kills at least 8 people, India’s police say AP News
Police confirmed there were fatalities from a car explosion near a metro station close to the Red Fort landmark.

The explosion also caused a fire that damaged nearby vehicles. The cause of the blast is currently under investigation, and it has been noted as a rare event in the heavily guarded capital city. Authorities and emergency services responded to the scene.

title: Canada Loses Measles Elimination Status Amid Outbreak
snippets: Canada loses measles elimination status after three decades Reuters
A large, ongoing outbreak that began in Canada in 2024 has cost the country its measles elimination status.
Canada virtually eliminated measles in 1998. Now, a disease that doctors in the country knew only from textbooks is back.
The disease was once considered eliminated in Canada, but not any more — there have been more than 5,000 cases in the last 12 months as vaccination rates have fallen.
Alberta’s measles outbreaks have sickened nearly 2,000 people – almost all unvaccinated – since March and killed an infant who contracted the disease in the womb.
Measles is the most contagious infectious disease known to mankind, but the measles vaccine is highly effective at preventing it.

TORONTO — Canada has officially lost the measles elimination status it had held since 1998, causing the entire region of the Americas to also lose the designation. The status is granted and revoked by the Pan American Health Organization, the World Health Organization’s office for countries in North
titles: Canada loses measles elimination status after three decades - Reuters
Canada has lost its 'measles elimination status' — here's what that means

summary: Canada has lost its measles elimination status, a designation held since 1998, due to an ongoing outbreak with over 5,000 cases reported in the last year. This loss also affects the entire Americas region's status. The outbreak marks the return of a disease once considered virtually eradicated in Canada, attributed to declining vaccination rates. The measles vaccine is known for its high effectiveness against the highly contagious disease.

title: BBC Top Executives Resign Amid Trump Speech Editing Controversy

A lawyer for President Trump said the BBC’s editing of a speech he gave was “defamatory.” The broadcaster apologized on Monday for an “error in judgment.”
And how will the U.S. government shutdown end?

Trump threatened the BBC with a $1bn lawsuit for defamation. The broadcaster admitted to an "error in judgment" and issued an apology. This controversy stemmed from accusations of bias and led to the resignation of the two top executives at Britain's national broadcaster.

title: Kurtz, Baldwin Win 2025 MLB Rookie of the Year Awards
snippets: Athletics first baseman Nick Kurtz was selected the American League Rookie of the Year on Monday night after hitting 36 home runs with 98 RBIs in 117 games, while catcher Drake Baldwin of the Atlanta Braves took home the National League's top honors.
Baseball's best players and managers of 2025 are collecting their hardware, starting with a pair of rookies from the A's and Braves.
Kurtz beat out Jacob Wilson and Roman Anthony, while Baldwin bested Caleb Durbin and Cade Horton
Nick Kurtz and Drake Baldwin earn 2025 MLB Rookie of the Year honors. Stats, highlights, and the next wave of baseball rookies to watch in 2026.

Slugging Athletics first baseman Nick Kurtz and breakout Atlanta Braves catcher Drake Baldwin have been named the MLB Jackie Robinson Rookies of the Year. The two were announced as the winners on MLB Network Monday night. Kurtz won the American League honours unanimously, earning all 30 first-place votes from the Baseball Writers’ Association of America (BBWAA). The 22-year-old slashed .290/.383/.619, hit 36 homers and drove in 86 runs over his first 117 games with the A’s. He becomes the 14th unanimous winner of the AL rookie of the year and the first A’s player to win the award since Andrew...
titles: A's Kurtz, Braves' Baldwin named rookies of year

summary: Nick Kurtz of the Athletics and Drake Baldwin of the Braves were named the 2025 MLB Rookie of the Year for the American and National League, respectively. Kurtz hit 36 home runs with 98 RBIs in 117 games, winning unanimously with all 30 first-place votes. Baldwin's performance as catcher earned him top honors in the National League, standing out among rookies.

This decision comes as the Giants' record worsens to 2-8 for the season. The firing was partly due to the team's repeated failure to maintain double-digit leads, alongside concerns raised by the recent concussion of rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Appeal to Overturn Same-Sex Marriage Legalization
snippets: US Supreme Court rejects bid to overturn same-sex marriage right Reuters
Supreme Court rejects call to overturn its decision legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide AP News

A former official who refused to issue same-sex marriage licenses asked the Supreme Court to reconsider its landmark ruling that guaranteed the right to same-sex marriage. However, the Supreme Court rejected the bid.
Supreme Court rejects challenge to gay marriage decision Axios
LGBTQ+ advocates feared the conservative court might retreat from its 2015 decision upholding right to same-sex marriage
The Supreme Court turned away an appeal from a former Kentucky court clerk who refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples after the Supreme Court's 2015 ruling.

The U.S. Supreme Court rejected on Monday a bid by a former Kentucky county official to overturn its landmark 2015 ruling legalizing same-sex marriage nationwide, as the justices steered clear of the contentious case some 3-1/2 years after its conservative majority reversed abortion rights.
Supreme Court Rejects Bid to Overturn Same-Sex Marriage Rights Bloomberg.com

summary: The U.S. Supreme Court declined an appeal from Kim Davis, a former Kentucky clerk who refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, to overturn its 2015 decision in Obergefell v. Hodges that legalized same-sex marriage nationwide. The justices rejected the challenge without comment, maintaining the legal status of same-sex marriage.

title: David Szalay Wins 2025 Booker Prize for Novel "Flesh"
snippets: The British-Hungarian author wins for his sixth novel, which has been championed by Dua Lipa and Stormzy.
Writer David Szalay wins prestigious Booker Prize for fiction with his earthy novel ‘Flesh’ AP News
British-Hungarian author David Szalay has won the 2025 Booker Prize worth 50,000 pounds for his dark novel "Flesh."
Son sixième roman, à l’écriture très ciselée, retrace la vie d’un Hongrois, homme ordinaire ayant émigré à Londres, jusqu’à son retour dans son pays natal à un âge avancé.

The judges ‘had never read anything quite like it’, says panel chair Roddy Doyle, announcing the Hungarian-British author’s novel as the winner of the £50,000 award Justine Jordan: The risky strategy of Booker winner Flesh pays off Hungarian-British author David Szalay has won the 2025 Booker prize

summary: British-Hungarian author David Szalay has won the 2025 Booker Prize, receiving £50,000 for his novel "Flesh." The book, his sixth, details the life of an ordinary Hungarian man who migrates to London and later returns to his homeland. Celebrated by figures like Dua Lipa and Stormzy, and praised for its unique and finely crafted narrative, "Flesh" was highlighted by judges, including chair Roddy Doyle, for its distinctiveness, marking a significant achievement in Szalay's career.

title: Typhoon Fung-wong Kills 8 in Philippines, Displaces 1.4M
snippets: The super typhoon has left devastation in the Philippines just days after another typhoon killed 232 people.
The storm hit the Philippines, killing at least four people and displacing more than 1.4 million others.
Less than a week after a storm left more than 200 people dead in the Philippines, an even stronger one hit.
Grabbing children and leaving their homes behind, residents evacuated before Typhoon Fung-wong hit.
titles: Typhoon Fung-wong leaves Philippines with 10 dead, 1.4 million displaced
WATCH:  Typhoon Fung-wong batters Philippines

A Million Evacuated as Typhoon Fung-Wong Hit the Philippines
summary: Typhoon Fung-wong, after hitting the Philippines, has led to at least eight deaths and displaced over 1.4 million people. The storm, which caused floods and landslides, weakened as it moved away from the country. Despite the typhoon's departure, authorities warn of ongoing risks from residual rains and flooding. This disaster follows closely on the heels of another storm that killed over 200 people in the same region.

title: Roslovic's OT Goal Lifts Oilers to 5-4 Win Over Blue Jackets

This win comes after the Oilers faced a 9-1 loss to the Colorado Avalanche. Roslovic's goal followed a crucial save by Oilers' goalie Stuart Skinner, securing the comeback win for Edmonton.

He plans to accelerate his philanthropic efforts, particularly by increasing the disbursement of his Berkshire stock to his children's foundations, as he retains a significant stake in the company. His children are now aged 72, 70, and 67. Despite the transition, Buffett intends to continue writing letters and emphasizes the importance of giving, especially in times when the market is down.

title: Trump Pardons 77, Including Giuliani and Meadows, in "Reconciliation" Move
snippets: Trump pardons Giuliani, others accused of seeking to overturn his 2020 defeat Reuters

summary: Former U.S. President Donald Trump has pardoned 77 individuals, including Rudy Giuliani, Mark Meadows, and Sidney Powell, who were accused of attempting to overturn the 2020 election results. These pardons, described by the Trump administration as part of a "national reconciliation" effort, affect those who supported Trump's unfounded claims of election fraud and engaged in actions such as pressuring Vice President Pence and organizing fake electors. Despite the federal clemency, some individuals may still face legal challenges at the state level.

title: Trump Hosts Syrian Leader al-Sharaa, Signaling Shift in Relations
snippets: Syria’s Sharaa meets Trump at White House in historic US visit - as it happened Reuters
"I think this leader can do it". US President Donald Trump praised Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa.

Syria's Ahmed al-Sharaa — once listed as a global terrorist — has now met the US president twice. In less than a year, al-Sharaa has seen his role transformed from Islamist rebel commander to international statesman.
The visit by President Ahmed al-Shara is another step in the transformation of the former rebel leader once wanted by the United States as a terrorist.

This event, highlighted by Reuters, underscores al-Sharaa's transformation from a former Islamist rebel commander and global terrorist to an international statesman, evidenced by his second meeting with the U.S. president within a year.

title: MLB Sets $200 Limit on Pitch Bets, Bans Parlays After Scandal
snippets: Major League Baseball said its authorized gaming operators will cap bets on individual pitches at $200 US and exclude them from parlays, a day after two Cleveland Guardians were indicted and accused of rigging pitches at the behest of gamblers.

Major League Baseball said its authorized gaming operators will cap bets on individual pitches at $200 and exclude them from parlays, a day after two Cleveland Guardians were indicted and accused of rigging pitches at the behest of gamblers.

This move aims to reduce manipulation following the indictment of two Cleveland Guardians players accused of rigging pitches for gamblers.

The match, described as unattractive for offense enthusiasts but appealing for defense fans, highlighted the Eagles' defensive strength in Week 10 of the NFL season.

title: Canada Loses Measles Elimination Status Amid Outbreak
snippets: Canada has lost its measles elimination status as vaccination rates have slipped below the 95% coverage rate needed to stop outbreaks Canada is no longer measles-free because of ongoing outbreaks , international health experts said on Monday, as childhood vaccination rates fall and the highly contag
Canada Loses Measles-Free Status With Outbreak Passing One-Year Mark Bloomberg.com
The Americas Are No Longer Officially Measles-Free Scientific American
titles: Canada no longer measles-free as outbreaks spread
Canada Loses Measles-Free Status With Outbreak Passing One-Year Mark - Bloomberg.com
The Americas Are No Longer Officially Measles-Free - Scientific American
summary: Canada has lost its measles elimination status, a designation held since 1998, due to an ongoing outbreak with over 5,000 cases reported in the last year. This loss also affects the entire Americas region's status. The outbreak marks the return of a disease once considered virtually eradicated in Canada, attributed to declining vaccination rates. The measles vaccine is known for its high effectiveness against the highly contagious disease.

title: Cunningham Scores 46 in Pistons' OT Win Despite Record Misses
snippets: Pistons star Cade Cunningham scored 46 points on 45 shots in a wild overtime win vs. the Wizards. His 31 misses were the most since the 1976-77 merger.

Cade Cunningham scored 46 points on a whopping 45 shots, Daniss Jenkins made the tying 3-pointer to force overtime and the Detroit Pistons rallied to beat the Washington Wizards 137-135 on Monday night.
titles: Pistons' Cunningham has 46 on 45 shots in OT win
Cade Cunningham drops 46, rallies Pistons to overtime win over Wizards
summary: Cade Cunningham led the Detroit Pistons to a 137-135 overtime victory against the Washington Wizards, scoring 46 points from 45 shots, the most misses (31) in a game since the 1976-77 merger. Daniss Jenkins hit a crucial 3-pointer to force overtime.

title: Pakistan Court Blast: Suicide Attack Kills 12, Injures Many

summary: An explosion outside a district court in Pakistan's capital resulted in at least 12 fatalities and several injuries. The blast occurred near the court's entrance, a typically crowded area. The interior minister confirmed the incident was a suicide attack.
